data.prayer: Father, thank you that you will never abandon the church of Tipperary, Ireland.
data.verse: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Tipperary, Ireland
data.section_summary: What people or activities could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, please raise up evangelists to equip your people to share the gospel in Tipperary.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Father, move the 2,481 believers in the state of Tipperary to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: Father, please give the people in the state of Tipperary access to a Bible in their own language.
God, we ask you to raise up elders and deacons from the 2,481 believers in Tipperary, who will serve the church and equip it to do your work.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God and become mature, attaining to the whole measure of the fullness of Christ.

data.prayer: Father, for those with enemies and who are afraid in Tipperary, call them into your shelter and safety today.
data.verse: For you have been a refuge for me, a strong tower from the enemy.

data.prayer: Spirit, disrupt complacency in the 2,481 believers living in the state of Tipperary. Remind them you are coming soon.
data.verse: Therefore, stay awake, for you do not know on what day your Lord is coming.

data.section_summary:
the state of Tipperary, Ireland has a population of 159,600.

We estimate Tipperary has 2,481 people who might know Jesus, 143,403 people who might know about Jesus culturally, and 13,716 people who do not know Jesus.

This is 1 believer for every 64 neighbors who need Jesus.
